reviewText: First off if you're looking for a sim truck racing game, then don't bother with this game. If you're looking for a fun arcade racer with trucks then this is the game for you. The game is a blast to play once you get the hang of the trucks. The physics in the game are actually quite good and the trucks handle nicely to boot. You can choose between 6 trucks in championship mode and all can be upgraded. You have 2 types of roads with dirt and asphalt with dirt having a slight loose feel to it but still feels the same as asphalt. You can upgrade the tracks for both dirt and asphalt but I just set one up for dirt and another for asphalt. For multiplayer I can't tell you how it is since its basicly dead. But for a pretty fun racing game, this is a blast.

reviewText: To start off I would like to say that I didn't expect much from this game.  It was on sale and I love racing games so I usually try most of them out.  It isn't a realistic racing game, it's more of an arcade style game.  There is a lot to keep you busy from the amount of races to the achievements.  My Xbox controller works really well for the game and I've had no issues with the controls.  Of course there are some flaws in the game but nothing major worth mentioning.  If you enjoy racing games you should pick this up when it goes on sale.

reviewText: This MONDAY, MONDAY, MONDAY, throw in some Truck Racer to race TRUCKS or any day really.  Get in a Big rig of steel, just like Euro Truck Sim, except now with 100% more racing!  Menus are easy to navigate, probably one of the best UI's made in a long time.  All the menus are awesome, they flow really easily, not much of a learning curve for people familiar with race games.  Best part is I havent noticed that rubber band AI stuff, where one accident spells doom as evry car races past you but no matter how good you do they are always catching up.  In fact they crash and all kinds of amusing stuff catching up.  The races arent too long, so its easy to play a round then go do something and then pick it up again later.  Loads of customization, other trucks, and upgrades keep the game interesting.\n\nRating:  10/10  Value:  $24.99

reviewText:
Truck Racer does exactly what its title suggests: There are trucks, and you race them. Generic title aside, Truck Racer is a fairly good arcade-oriented big rig racing game that is held back by a lack of difficulty and empty multiplayer lobbies. If you must buy it, wait for a sale.

Truck Racer follows the standard racing game blueprint: you race transport trucks through a series of increasingly difficult tournaments, trying to earn enough credits to unlock the next tournament. Credits earned can be used to purchase new trucks and unlock better performance parts. There are six trucks to choose from and quite a few different parts to unlock, and it's fun mixing and matching components to get the best possible performance out of your vehicles.

The racing in Truck Racer is decent, with good course design and responsive controls. There's lots of banging and crashing as the trucks battle for position; expect to see lots of pileups and parts littering the tracks. Trucks can get damaged, but damage doesn't seem to affect handling. It's possible for trucks to take enough damage to render them useless, but don't expect it to happen even once over the course of the eight or so hours it takes to complete Truck Racer's career mode.

Since it's an arcade-oriented racer, the physics in Truck Racer are a bit more relaxed. The trucks drift fairly easily, and crashes   that should flip the truck never will. This keeps the action moving along, although somewhat curiously Truck Racer doesn't have a reset to track" feature
date: which means if your truck spins out and you're facing in the wrong direction
recommended: you'll have to slowly back up and get back on the track manually.\n\nTruck Racer's biggest problem is its level of difficulty. This is an easy racing game. You'll finish atop the podium in every race the first time you race it. Part of this is due to the game's AI: computer-controlled racers are kind of dumb
hoursPlayed: and they have real problems getting unstuck from accidents. While the other trucks are trying to get going again after a pileup
voteText: you'll leave them in the dust and the lack of rubber-banding means the other trucks will never catch up to you. Expect to win many races by more than 30 seconds. Even on Expert difficulty
helpfulPercent: Truck Racer is a breeze.\n\nLive competition would cancel out the bad AI in Truck Racer's single-player mode
votesHelpful: but no one is playing this game online. This means Truck Racer has a short shelf life
votesTotal: unless you know some people who have the game and will play multiplayer.\n\nSteam achievements add some extra replay value
votesFunny: for people who are into that sort of thing. There are fifty in all
commentsCount: with most of them obtainable in career mode.\n\nTruck Racer is a decent racing game
column16: with the added novelty of being one of the few titles out there that only feature trucks.   It's a good game to pick up in a sale."

reviewText:
Great fun in a bundle with 8 other games for $4 and well worth it but I wouldn't pay the current listed $20.

If you're a serious racing fan and get your thrills with a steering wheel then this isnt for you (but you already knew that and are heading back to Assetto Corsa right now).  If however, you're a fan of racing and can enjoy it lightheartedly with a 360 controller then this title is an entertaining way of whiling away a sunday afternoon.

Most cheap racing games suffer badly with clipping with your vehicle being bounced off or speared by invisable barriers but in a couple of hours racing I only had 3 incidents which represented a minor annoyance.  Online achievements will be hard to get without organising with friends but as someone who prefers to play solo I didn't have any issues there.

Race your truck, upgrade your truck, smash some trucks and race some more = good times!

reviewText:
It's allright.

Doesn't look AAA, doesn't drive AAA but it can be enjoyed if you won't set your expectations too high.

+lots of tracks/combinations, night, rain, etc.
+damage system.
+if you don't hit the roadside, truck-driving can be enjoyable (depends on the truck you bought, the upgrades you applied)
+classic gameplay: you race, you earn money, you buy new trucks/upgrades, so you can race on higher class championships

-too easy, no difficulity settings
-bit repetitive but fortunatelly the whole game isn't that long (completed the career in 6 hours)
-sound! truck's engine sound makes me mad :D

If you like arcade racers, especially trucks - buy it! There aren't many options out there.

(last truck racer I played (and loved!) was Mercedes Benz Truck Racing)

reviewText:
-Super easy
-I have all the money in the world after a few races
-If I didn't have all the money in the world I could get it by racing the same race over and over again, and finishing a place better each time which gets me a lot of credits, more than getting first place the first time
-Arcade style physics
-Physics are excessively jerky, bouncy, and it's impossible to flip the vehicles
-Hiting the wall means nothing
-One damage bar for the engine only represents the whole truck
-Going full nitro intentionaly into a wall at an angle hardly scratched my truck
-pieces fall off the trucks all the time and it means nothing
-Invincible tires
-scenery is nice, but the same pieces are used a bunch

I'd complain if the game weren't on Steam.  Now that it is I don't think it should be.  It's a waste of time and money.  The only reason to buy it is an easy 100% in achievements.  *racing friends is kinda fun, but rarely are people online.

reviewText:
Truck Racer - an unexpected diamond in the rough

Before I downloaded this game, it seemed to scream 'cheap piece of rubbish'. It was in a bundle with a bunch of rubbish games, and what sort of a name is Truck Racer? I was expecting a half-hearted truck simulator with awful physics, ugly graphics and bad controls. Luckily, I was very, very wrong.

If you haven't gathered from the other review, this game is an arcade racer. If you go in expecting a simulator, you'll be disappointed. The trucks seem heavy but agile, and the game's pace is relatively slow; there isn't a real feel of speed, but this acts in the game's advantage, as it is more about staying on the track and smashing your opponents than getting that perfect racing line and improving your PB lap times.

The models are nice with satisfying damage models, the sounds are basic but not awful, the graphical effects are good, if a bit distracting at times, and the menus & UI are beautiful. The trucks have a decent amount of upgrades, but little visual customisation. There are a number of trucks to choose from, but they are all one of two models, with slightly different bodykits. Paint colour can be customised, but that's about it.

Overall, while it may not be the best arcade racer out there, you can tell that Truck Racer has had a lot of time and effort put into it, and I can easily recommend it for some mindless fun.

reviewText:
This game really surprised me. It has a really deep tunning and upgrade system which really has a big influence on your trucks performance. The tracks are all laid out well and grow more difficult as you progress through the championship mode, and the game offers around 6 hours of gameplay in that championship mode. All in all a really underrated gem.

reviewText: Pretty decent arcade style racing game.  Not many others out there to compete with it since it is semi truck racing.  The game could be better though such as when you change from asphalt tires to dirt tires the 3D image of the tires on your truck does not change at all.  And it would be nice if there was an achievement for lapping other drivers during a race.  And when you do lap another driver, the game tells you how far that driver is behind you instead of the 2nd place driver (assuming your in 1st place).  Graphics could be a tad bit better as well.  Graphics are not bad but other racing games shine better in comparison.  But hey, what can you expect from a $4 game?  I'm just glad the devs didn't add missle launchers to the trucks (that's just not my style).  I do love the pieces flying off the trucks though when they smash into each other.  If you love racing games and you like trucks, well then stop reading reviews and add this game to your library.

reviewText: Not a bad game, but the AI is incredibly dumb. This becomes a major issue in harder races because the challenge comes not from better AI, but by having to dodge dead trucks as you overlap opponents on longer races; for harder races, the trucks just go faster without any other adjustments resulting in them knocking themselves or each other out.\n\nAs others have been stating, the game's achievements are not hard to obtain with the exception of the online achievements since no one is ever online.

reviewText:
The game itself is quite fun, phisics, gameplay and graphic are pretty decent, but it has two main flaws:

1)AI: your opponents are completly stupid and unware of others on track; result: every race becomes a destruction derby after 1 lap
2)main carreer design: you basically earn too much money, that you will spend on upgrades for your vehicle

those two flaws combined make the game waaay too easy. it's a shame because it can be a very fun and challenging game with only minor refinments.

I can recommend it only on discount as a 5-minutes waster
